intro: Leucanthemum ircutianum, commonly known as the Snowy Marguerite, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its white to pale yellow flowers, which are surrounded by a ring of finely divided, white ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with a basal rosette of gray-green, hairy leaves. Its flowering period occurs in late summer to early autumn, and it prefers well-drained soils in full sun to partial shade. Leucanthemum ircutianum is often used in garden settings for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to cultivate.
